summary.Title: ERP Specialist

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
The IT Department today and tomorrow

The IT department consists of two teams/functions responsible for the global IT setup; ERP and Infrastructure, where you will play an important part in the ERP team. Due to a continuous wish to strengthen our business through smarter use of our primary systems, we need to strengthen our internal capacity within this area. The team is responsible for ensuring optimal use of the systems, challenging processes and identity problems and possible improvements, and qualify solutions in Service Desk tool. All in close cooperation with employees and managers across the organization

 

Tasks

Daily tasks will primarily evolve around our improvement project of the D365FO, where you need to identify opportunities for improvement together with the organization. Furthermore, the normal workday will also involve ad-hoc support to our users and super-users assigned to you though our Service Desk.

Primary tasks:

  • Participate in the D365 improvement project.
  • Knowledge of or the desire to learn one or more of the following modules/add-ons:
    • ExFlow IWF
    • AMC Banking
    • T&A
    • Project module
    • Budget module
  • Maintenance and compose SOP, guides and training of users.
  • Knowledge of Cubes and PowerBI would be preferred, but is not a must-have.

 

Our infrastructure is primarily based on the following technologies:

  • Microsoft SQL analysis services (Cubes)
  • Microsoft PowerBI
  • Microsoft Dynamics 365 FO
  • Microsoft Axapta 3.0 (to be discontinued)

 

Your profile

We are imagining that you have minimum 2 years of experience as an ERP specialist/consultant, finance controller or similar - your education background is not important, but rather your experience with D365FO or similar ERP systems, combined with your analytic and structured approach to the challenges are the key to your success.  

We also value:

  • Knowledge on Microsoft SQL Analysis Services and cubes
  • General knowledge on value chain management and MRP/MPS

 

English is our main company language, so you’ll need to be comfortably fluent in both writing and speaking it too.

 

About what we offer

An exciting job in an international company with good professional and personal development opportunities, and where you influence the company´s further development.

You’ll have a chance to listen to the music you love on some truly amazing speakers (including getting the opportunity to buy them at a pleasing discount), and even get to see behind the scenes on how they’re made, tested and designed in-house at the factory. We have recently re-opened our canteen where we serve excellent and nutritious meals, and our Staff Club ensures lots of activities for those willing to participate in events as part of their working experience at Dynaudio.

The salary is negotiated individually at a level that corresponds to the position requirements and your qualifications.

If you have any questions, please reach out to our IT Director, Jonas Uldahl Jensen via juj@dynaudio.com or +45 9189 3773

 

About Dynaudio

Dynaudio is one of the world\\'s largest speaker manufacturers. Founded in 1977 in Skanderborg, Denmark, we have more than 40 years of experience in producing high-end speakers.

Today, Dynaudio exports to 80 countries around the world and has received awards everywhere for the products. Dynaudio today has approx. 300 employees. Development and production take place in Skanderborg, where Dynaudio, in collaboration with VW and other highly regarded car manufacturers, also develops sound systems. Dynaudio has extreme quality requirements and is highly certified.

Late in 2014, Goertek Inc., China, acquired the majority shares of Dynaudio. Goertek Inc. is world leader in the development and manufacturing of AR/VR glasses and Bluetooth equipment. They’re also the top producer of microphones, flat screens, and micro loudspeakers/transducers in the world.
